perturbation.original_text: SRP will build and provide to Logan's a 1997 Ford Thunderbird automobile ("Show Car") that will have an appearance identical to that of the race car, to include full roll cage, race interior, paint, graphics and under-hood race look. Logan's will provide equipment and driver to transport the Show Car to destinations and according to schedules as determined by Logan's. At the expiration of this contract, Logan's will return the Show Car to SRP in substantially the same condition as when received by Logan's, normal wear and tear excepted.
perturbation.changed_text: SRP will provide a show car to Logan's. Logan's will transport the Show Car to destinations as determined by Logan's. At the expiration of this contract, Logan's will return the Show Car to SRP.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specifics of what the show car entails and its expected condition upon return (including 'full roll cage, race interior, paint, graphics and under-hood race look' and 'substantially the same condition as when received by Logan's, normal wear and tear excepted'), the modified text creates ambiguity. If the race car’s standards change over the race season (logos removed, etc.) there is no requirement to keep the Show Car aligned with the same graphics as the Race Car. This omission creates uncertainty in Logan's obligation to maintain the Show Car. It also removes SRP’s obligation to building a 1997 Ford Thunderbird.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party ("the Terminating Party") may terminate this Agreement upon prior written notice to the other party (the "Defaulting Party") upon the occurrence of any of the following conditions:

              (i) In the event that such party materially breaches this   Agreement or materially defaults in the performance of any obligation hereunder and fails to cure said breach within 30 days of written notice to the Defaulting Party by the Terminating Party;

              (ii) Immediately in the event that the Defaulting Party   (including, for SRP, the Driver) commits any crime involving moral turpitude or otherwise commits any act or is involved in any situation bringing itself, the Terminating Party or the products of the Terminating Party into public hatred or contempt, or engages in conduct that shocks or insults the community or brings the Terminating Party, or its products into public disrespect, scandal or ridicule; or

              (iii) In the event the LMSC series at NMS is canceled.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party ("the Terminating Party") may terminate this Agreement upon prior written notice to the other party (the "Defaulting Party") upon the occurrence of any of the following conditions:

              (i) In the event that such party breaches this   Agreement and fails to cure said breach within 30 days of written notice to the Defaulting Party by the Terminating Party;

              (ii) Immediately in the event that the Defaulting Party   (including, for SRP, the Driver) commits any crime or otherwise commits any act or is involved in any situation bringing itself, the Terminating Party into public hatred or contempt; or

              (iii) In the event the LMSC series at NMS is canceled.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word 'materially' from the breach condition in (i), and removing the portion of (ii) reading 'or the products of the Terminating Party into public hatred or contempt, or engages in conduct that shocks or insults the community or brings the Terminating Party, or its products into public disrespect, scandal or ridicule;', the modified text broadens the scope of termination. Now, a minor breach can result in termination where before it had to be 'material'. The standard of 'crime involving moral turpitude' is also diminished and the Terminating Party does not have to be at risk of 'public disrespect, scandal or ridicule' to terminate the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Logan's shall have the exclusive use of the hood, the rear quarter panel area above the tire and the bottom of the deck lid (rear facing panel, TV panel) of the Race Car, as shown on Exhibit C to this Agreement. All other areas permitted by NASCAR for sponsor signage, logos or trademarks and the "spoiler space" are reserved for NASCAR, SRP and the associate and secondary sponsors. All associate and secondary sponsors' graphic layouts for the Race Car are subject to Logan's approval, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Furthermore, SRP shall not permit any associate or secondary sponsor to suggest in any manner that its sponsorship role is as great as that of Logan's.
perturbation.changed_text: Logan's shall have the exclusive use of the hood, the rear quarter panel area above the tire and the bottom of the deck lid of the Race Car. All other areas permitted by NASCAR for sponsor signage, logos or trademarks and the "spoiler space" are reserved for NASCAR, SRP and the associate and secondary sponsors. All associate and secondary sponsors' graphic layouts for the Race Car are subject to Logan's approval. Furthermore, SRP shall not permit any associate or secondary sponsor to suggest in any manner that its sponsorship role is as great as that of Logan's.
perturbation.explanation: By removing '(rear facing panel, TV panel)' and 'which shall not be unreasonably withheld', the omission creates a potential contradiction. Without defining what the deck lid is, there can be disagreement on where Logan’s signage should go. Removing the 'not be unreasonably withheld' clause gives Logan's the ability to deny any signage from SRP's associate and secondary sponsors. This could create an issue later if SRP relied on signage of other sponsors to offset costs.
